justification: The article notes that the statConfR package "allows for the computation of popular measures of metacognitive performance like meta-d′ (Maniscalco & Lau, 2012)", explicitly tying the construct of metacognitive performance to the meta-d′ metric.

When describing both example data sets and model fitting, the authors state that participants "reported their perceived motion direction … simultaneously with their confidence using the keyboard. Confidence was reported on a 4-point scale," indicating that decision confidence is operationalised through a discrete multi-level confidence rating scale.
